name: Franklin Tree
climate: The Franklin Tree thrives in a temperate climate with mild winters.
It prefers regions where summers are not excessively hot or dry.
The plant requires a stable climate, avoiding extreme cold and heat.
A humid environment supports the growth of the Franklin Tree.
sunlight: This plant grows best in full sun to partial shade conditions.
Direct sunlight for several hours a day promotes strong growth.
However, too much intense sunlight can cause leaf scorch.
Partial shade in hot climates helps prevent dehydration.
watering: The Franklin Tree needs regular watering, especially in dry periods.
Overwatering should be avoided to prevent root rot and fungus.
A consistent moisture level supports healthy growth of the tree.
Ensure proper drainage to allow excess water to escape effectively.
soil: The plant grows well in acidic, well-drained soil for optimal health.
Soil rich in organic matter helps retain necessary soil moisture.
Sandy loam is ideal, providing both nutrient retention and drainage.
Avoid using overly alkaline soils as they can impede growth.
extra_care_tip: Regularly removing dead branches helps maintain tree health.
Mulching around the base conserves moisture and moderates soil temperature.
